title: Income tax clearance mandatory to leave India? Centre issues a clarification. Here's what it says
selftext:
> Responding to the reports, which created a significant stir, the CBDT said Section 230 does not mandate every individual domiciled in India to secure a tax clearance certificate before departure.
>
> The requirement applies only under specific circumstances. According to the CBDT’s Instruction No. 1/2004, dated February 5, 2004, a tax clearance certificate is necessary only for individuals involved in serious financial irregularities or those with significant direct tax arrears exceeding Rs. 10 lakh, provided these arrears have not been stayed by any authority.
comments: They have backed out after seeing the public reaction. The finance bill clearly says: *"No person who is domiciled in India, shall leave India, unless he obtains a certificate from the income-tax authorities stating that he has no liabilities under the Income-tax Act ..."* Now they say it only applies to those who have pending tax notices.
Just convert everyone officially to bonded labour. Why this charade of freedom when anyway government takes everything.
